info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 4:22PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Mineral and west central Sanders Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 422 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lookout Pass, or 10 miles east of Wallace, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Thompson Falls, Snider, Belknap, White Pine, East Portal, Trout Creek and Taft. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 0 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
